headline: Comcast (CMCSA) Outpaces Stock Market Gains: What You Should Know
summary: The latest trading day saw Comcast (CMCSA) settling at $35.01, representing a +1.36% change from its previous close.

headline: Verizon boosts annual forecast, shares rise
summary: STORY: Shares of Verizon jumped more than four and a half percent Monday morning, after the wireless carrier raised the lower end of its annual profit forecast.That was thanks to strong demand for its premium plans and the Trump administration’s new tax law.The telecom giant said it's benefiting from favorable tax reform that allows companies to immediately write off the full cost of certain new equipment, boosting free cash flow.Verizon also beat Wall Street estimates for second-quarter sales and profit.Verizon has launched promotions and broadband-wireless bundles to retain users as competition intensifies from AT&T and T-Mobile, as well as broadband providers Comcast and Charter.But Verizon posted a surprise drop of 9,000 monthly bill-paying wireless subscribers in the second quarter, reeling from user churn after price hikes in January.Analysts polled by FactSet were expecting an increase of 13,000 subscribers.To drive growth, Verizon and its rivals have been bulking up on fiber-optic assets that can tap growing consumer data use.The company in May won approval from the FCC to acquire fiber-optic internet provider Frontier after Verizon agreed to end its diversity, equity and inclusion programs.The focus on internet services helped it post 293,000 broadband net additions in the second quarter.Verizon's earnings also helped lift shares of rivals AT&T and T-Mobile in Monday morning trading.

headline: Verizon boosts annual forecast on demand for premium plans, tax law benefit
summary: Shares of the company rose 3.5% on Monday as it also surpassed Wall Street estimates for June-quarter sales and profit, thanks to a 2.2% rise in wireless service revenue.  The telecom major has launched price-lock promotions and broadband-wireless bundles to retain users as competition intensifies from AT&T and T-Mobile, as well as broadband providers Comcast and Charter.  Verizon is also benefiting from favorable U.S. tax reform that allows companies to immediately write off the full cost of certain new equipment, finance chief Tony Skiadas said.

Verizon is also benefiting from favorable U.S. tax reform that allows companies to immediately write off the full cost of certain new equipment, finance chief Tony Skiadas said.
